t: Luke 11
The Lord’s Prayer
He*p was praying in a certain place, and when he finished, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John also taught his disciples.”
He*p said to them, “Whenever*r you*r pray,*r say,*r Father,*rpn your*rln name*r be*r honored*r as*r holy.*r Your*rln kingdom*r come.*r
Give*rln us*r each*r day*r our*r daily*r bread.*r
And*rln forgive*r us*r our*r sins,*r for*rln we*r ourselves*r also*r forgive*r everyone*r in*rln debt*r to*r us.*r And*rln do*r not*r bring*r us*r into*r temptation.”*r
Ask, Search, Knock
He*p also said to them, “Suppose*r one*r of*r you*r has*r a*r friend*r and*r goes*r to*r him*r at*r midnight*r and*r says*r to*r him,*r ‘Friend,*r lend*r me*r three*r loaves*r of*r bread,*r
because*r a*r friend*r of*r mine*r on*r a*r journey*r has*r come*r to*r me,*r and*r I*r don’t*r have*r anything*r to*r offer*r him.’*r

Then*r he*r will*r answer*r from*r inside*r and*r say,*r ‘Don’t*r bother*r me!*r The*r door*r is*r already*r locked,*r and*r my*r children*r and*r I*r have*r gone*r to*r bed.*r I*r can’t*r get*r up*r to*r give*r you*r anything.’*r

I*r tell*r you,*r even*r though*r he*r won’t*r get*r up*r and*r give*r him*r anything*r because*r he*r is*r his*r friend,*r yet*r because*r of*r his*r friend’s*r shameless*r boldness,*r he*r will*r get*r up*r and*r give*r him*r as*r much*r as*r he*r needs.*r
“So*rp I*r say*r to*r you,*r ask,*r and*r it*r will*r be*r given*r to*r you.*r Seek,*r and*r you*r will*r find.*r Knock,*r and*r the*r door*r will*r be*r opened*r to*r you.*r
For*r everyone*r who*r asks*r receives,*r and*r the*r one*r who*r seeks*r finds,*r and*r to*r the*r one*r who*r knocks,*r the*r door*r will*r be*r opened.*r
What*r father*r among*r you,*r if*r his*r son*r asks*r for*r a*r fish,*r will*r give*r him*r a*r snake*r instead*r of*r a*r fish?*r
Or*r if*r he*r asks*r for*r an*r egg,*r will*r give*r him*r a*r scorpion?*r

If*r you*r then,*r who*r are*r evil,*r know*r how*r to*r give*r good*r gifts*r to*r your*r children,*r how*r much*r more*r will*r the*r heavenly*r Father*r give*r the*r Holy*r Spirit*r to*r those*r who*r ask*r him?”*r
A House Divided
Now*p he was driving out a demon that was mute. When the demon came out, the man who had been mute spoke, and the crowds were amazed.
But some of them said, “He drives out demons by Beelzebul, the ruler of the demons.”
And others, as a test, were demanding of him a sign from heaven.
Knowing*p their thoughts, he told them, “Every*r kingdom*r divided*r against*r itself*r is*r headed*r for*r destruction,*r and*r a*r house*r divided*r against*r itself*r falls.*r
If*r Satan*r also*r is*r divided*r against*r himself,*r how*r will*r his*r kingdom*r stand?*r For*r you*r say*r I*r drive*r out*r demons*r by*r Beelzebul.*r
And*r if*r I*r drive*r out*r demons*r by*r Beelzebul,*r by*r whom*r do*r your*r sons*r drive*r them*r out?*r For*r this*r reason*r they*r will*r be*r your*r judges.*r
If*r I*r drive*r out*r demons*r by*r the*r finger*r of*r God,*r then*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r has*r come*r upon*r you.*r
When*r a*r strong*r man,*r fully*r armed,*r guards*r his*r estate,*r his*r possessions*r are*r secure.*r
But*r when*r one*r stronger*r than*r he*r attacks*r and*r overpowers*r him,*r he*r takes*r from*r him*r all*r his*r weapons*r he*r trusted*r in,*r and*r divides*r up*r his*r plunder.*r
Anyone*r who*r is*r not*r with*r me*r is*r against*r me,*r and*r anyone*r who*r does*r not*r gather*r with*r me*r scatters.*r
An Unclean Spirit’s Return

“When*rp an*r unclean*r spirit*r comes*r out*r of*r a*r person,*r it*r roams*r through*r waterless*r places*r looking*r for*r rest,*r and*r not*r finding*r rest,*r it*r then*r says,*r ‘I’ll*r go*r back*r to*r my*r house*r that*r I*r came*r from.’*r
Returning,*r it*r finds*r the*r house*r swept*r and*r put*r in*r order.*r

Then*r it*r goes*r and*r brings*r seven*r other*r spirits*r more*r evil*r than*r itself,*r and*r they*r enter*r and*r settle*r down*r there.*r As*r a*r result,*r that*r person’s*r last*r condition*r is*r worse*r than*r the*r first.”*r
True Blessedness
As*p he was saying these things, a woman from the crowd raised her voice and said to him, “Blessed is the womb that bore you and the one who nursed you!”
He*p said, “Rather,*r blessed*r are*r those*r who*r hear*r the*r word*r of*r God*r and*r keep*r it.”*r
The Sign of Jonah

As*p the crowds were increasing, he began saying, “This*r generation*r is*r an*r evil*r generation.*r It*r demands*r a*r sign,*r but*r no*r sign*r will*r be*r given*r to*r it*r except*r the*r sign*r of*r Jonah.*r
For*r just*r as*r Jonah*r became*r a*r sign*r to*r the*r people*r of*r Nineveh,*r so*r also*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r be*r to*r this*r generation.*r

The*r queen*r of*r the*r south*r will*r rise*r up*r at*r the*r judgment*r with*r the*r men*r of*r this*r generation*r and*r condemn*r them,*r because*r she*r came*r from*r the*r ends*r of*r the*r earth*r to*r hear*r the*r wisdom*r of*r Solomon,*r and*r look — something*r greater*r than*r Solomon*r is*r here.*r

The*r men*r of*r Nineveh*r will*r stand*r up*r at*r the*r judgment*r with*r this*r generation*r and*r condemn*r it,*r because*r they*r repented*r at*r Jonah’s*r preaching,*r and*r look — something*r greater*r than*r Jonah*r is*r here.*r
The Lamp of the Body
“No*rp one*r lights*r a*r lamp*r and*r puts*r it*r in*r the*r cellar*r or*r under*r a*r basket,*r but*r on*r a*r lampstand,*r so*r that*r those*r who*r come*r in*r may*r see*r its*r light.*r

Your*r eye*r is*r the*r lamp*r of*r the*r body.*r When*r your*r eye*r is*r healthy,*r your*r whole*r body*r is*r also*r full*r of*r light.*r But*r when*r it*r is*r bad,*r your*r body*r is*r also*r full*r of*r darkness.*r
Take*r care,*r then,*r that*r the*r light*r in*r you*r is*r not*r darkness.*r

If,*r therefore,*r your*r whole*r body*r is*r full*r of*r light,*r with*r no*r part*r of*r it*r in*r darkness,*r it*r will*r be*r entirely*r illuminated,*r as*r when*r a*r lamp*r shines*r its*r light*r on*r you.”*r
Religious Hypocrisy Denounced
As*p he was speaking, a Pharisee asked him to dine with him. So he went in and reclined at the table.
When the Pharisee saw this, he was amazed that he did not first perform the ritual washing before dinner.
But the Lord said to him, “Now*r you*r Pharisees*r clean*r the*r outside*r of*r the*r cup*r and*r dish,*r but*r inside*r you*r are*r full*r of*r greed*r and*r evil.*r
Fools!*r Didn’t*r he*r who*r made*r the*r outside*r make*r the*r inside*r too?*r
But*r give*r from*r what*r is*r within*r to*r the*r poor,*r and*r then*r everything*r is*r clean*r for*r you.*r

“But*rp woe*r to*r you*r Pharisees!*r You*r give*r a*r tenth*r of*r mint,*r rue,*r and*r every*r kind*r of*r herb,*r and*r you*r bypass*r justice*r and*r love*r for*r God.*r These*r things*r you*r should*r have*r done*r without*r neglecting*r the*r others.*r
“Woe*rp to*r you*r Pharisees!*r You*r love*r the*r front*r seat*r in*r the*r synagogues*r and*r greetings*r in*r the*r marketplaces.*r
“Woe*rp to*r you!*r You*r are*r like*r unmarked*r graves;*r the*r people*r who*r walk*r over*r them*r don’t*r know*r it.”*r
One*p of the experts in the law answered him, “Teacher, when you say these things you insult us too.”

Then*p he said, “Woe*r also*r to*r you*r experts*r in*r the*r law!*r You*r load*r people*r with*r burdens*r that*r are*r hard*r to*r carry,*r and*r yet*r you*r yourselves*r don’t*r touch*r these*r burdens*r with*r one*r of*r your*r fingers.*r
“Woe*rp to*r you!*r You*r build*r tombs*r for*r the*r prophets,*r and*r your*r fathers*r killed*r them.*r
Therefore,*r you*r are*r witnesses*r that*r you*r approve*r the*r deeds*r of*r your*r fathers,*r for*r they*r killed*r them,*r and*r you*r build*r their*r monuments.*r
Because*r of*r this,*r the*r wisdom*r of*r God*r said,*r ‘I*r will*r send*r them*r prophets*r and*r apostles,*r and*r some*r of*r them*r they*r will*r kill*r and*r persecute,’*r
so*r that*r this*r generation*r may*r be*r held*r responsible*r for*r the*r blood*r of*r all*r the*r prophets*r shed*r since*r the*r foundation*r of*r the*r world—*r

from*r the*r blood*r of*r Abel*r to*r the*r blood*r of*r Zechariah,*r who*r perished*r between*r the*r altar*r and*r the*r sanctuary.*r “Yes,*rp I*r tell*r you,*r this*r generation*r will*r be*r held*r responsible.*r

“Woe*rp to*r you*r experts*r in*r the*r law!*r You*r have*r taken*r away*r the*r key*r to*r knowledge.*r You*r didn’t*r go*r in*r yourselves,*r and*r you*r hindered*r those*r who*r were*r trying*r to*r go*r in.”*r
When*p he left there, the scribes and the Pharisees began to oppose him fiercely and to cross-examine him about many things;
they were lying in wait for him to trap him in something he said.
